00002  * @(#)cost.h 1.6 12/22/94 Delft University of Technology

00004 #ifndef __COST_H
00005 #define __COST_H
00006 
00007 typedef struct _NETSTATE
00008 {
00009 int *dist;       /* array[nx][ny], entry[i] = #cells connected to net in subarea i */
00010 int nx,ny;       /* nx * ny is #subareas */
00011 /* following entries are redundant but they speed up computing of the gains: */
00012 int cost;        /* cost of the current distribution */
00013 int deviation;   /* total #non-zero subareas */
00014 int *clm[3]; /* clm[0][j]=#non-zero entries in row j, row[1,2] is down,up neighbor */
00015 int *row[3]; /* clm[0][j]=#non-zero entries in clm j, clm[1,2] is left,right neighbor */
00016 int xl,xr,yb,yt; /* bounding box of the "active" rectangle */
00017 int numparts;    /* nx*ny --> #subareas */
00018 int netid;       /* this is just to make it easier to trace a net while debugging */
00019 }
00020 NETSTATE,*NETSTATEPTR;
00021 
00022 /* the legal indices to NETSTATE.clm[] and NETSTATE.row[] */
00023 #define LIST 0
00024 #define PREV 1
00025 #define NEXT 2
00026 
00027 
00028 extern int *cvrt_to_row; /* used by Row(i) macro */
00029 extern int *cvrt_to_clm; /* used by Clm(i) macro */
00030 
00031 #define Row(i) cvrt_to_row[i]
00032 #define Clm(i) cvrt_to_clm[i]
00033 
00034 
00035 /* These are valid indices for the function array (*costfunction[])()
00036  * [This is an array of functions returning the cost of their
00037  *  arguments. Currently they differ only in the number and format of
00038  *  their arguments]
00039  */
00040 #define COSTSTATE 0       /* argument list is (netstate) */
00041 #define COSTVEC   1       /* argument list is (xl,xr,yb,yt,deviation) */
00042 
00043 #define NewNetstate(p) ((p)=(NETSTATEPTR)mnew(sizeof(NETSTATE)))
00044 #define FreeNetstate(p) mfree((char **)(p),sizeof(NETSTATE))
00045 
00046 #endif
